title: Need to ID KFC Logo typefaces
content:
Hello Typophiles,  
I need some help identifying the logo typefaces used on [www.kfc.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20150225133955/http:/www.kfc.com/ "www.kfc.com") (the "Kentucky Fried" and "Chicken" typefaces). I'm thinking they may be custom fonts, but if they look familiar to any of you, please let me know. Thank you! :)

~megan

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [Picture 1.png](http://web.archive.org/web/20150225133955/http:/typophile.com/files/Picture%201_52.png) | 39 KB |
author: meganpru

comments.content:
Landor did the new logo...

[http://www.underconsideration.com/brandnew/archives/the\_colonels\_brand\_n...](http://web.archive.org/web/20150225133955/http:/www.underconsideration.com/brandnew/archives/the_colonels_brand_new_clothes.php "http://www.underconsideration.com/brandnew/archives/the\_colonels\_brand\_new\_clothes.php")

...that should help narrow it down... ;-)

Caflisch is what I was thinking, too, but it looks like it's been tweaked a little. I think I found a spoof font of their "Kentucky Fried" logo as well, that's about as close as I can get.

Thanks for the help all! :)
I guess some tweaking is waranted, if only to justify the exorbitant invoices Landor sent to KFC. :^P
On that link sii posted, it says that it was not Landor that did the rebrand? It says it was done by a firm called Tesser.

yes, Landor did the last one in 1997.

Tesser ( [www.tesser.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20150225133955/http:/www.tesser.com/ "www.tesser.com")) is taking credit for the new one.

\> On that link sii posted, it says that it was not Landor that did the rebrand? It says it was done by a firm called Tesser.

Oops - sorry about that
